verb.definition: To treat rubber or similar material with sulfur and heat to improve its strength, elasticity, and durability
verb.example: They vulcanized the rubber to make tougher tires.

noun.definition: The process of vulcanizing rubber or similar materials
noun.example: Vulcanization of the rubber made it suitable for use in industrial hoses.

usage_examples: The factory workers vulcanized the rubber components before assembly.
Proper vulcanization makes rubber products more resilient and long‑lasting.
